metadata.key_specifications: High efficiency stereo audio power amplifier, 2x20W into 8Ω BTL loads, I2S input, built-in anti-pop and protection circuits, supports 8-96kHz sampling rates, programmable data path, 3-band DRC and multi-band biquads.
metadata.applications: High-performance audio systems, active speakers, soundbars, TVs, and other multimedia applications requiring efficient and powerful audio amplification.

page_summaries.content:
The RT9114B is a high efficiency, I 2S-input, stereo channel audio power amplifier delivering 2x20W into 8 BTL speaker loads. It can deliver over 90% power efficiency and eliminate the need for heat-sink.

The built-in anti-pop functions can reduce the speaker's pop noise under all kind of scenarios. Built-in protection circuits can provide over -temperature, over -current, over-voltage, and under-voltage protections and report error status.

The RT9114B is an I2S device receiving all clocks from external sources. It can support both master and slave mode with wide input sampling rate from 8kHz to 96kHz. A fully programmable data path routes these channels to the internal speaker drivers.

The RT9114B features three band DRC and flexible multi-band biquads for anti-clipping, power limiting, and speaker equalization.

Marking Information
0E= : Product Code
YMDNN : Date Code

Functional Pin Description

Pin No.	Pin Name	IO	Pin Function
1	SDI	DI	I2S data input.
2	SDO	DO	I2S data output.
3	RESETB	DI	Reset, low active.
4	LRCK	DI	I2S L/R clock input.
5	SCLK	DI	I2S bit clock input.
6	MCLK	DI	Master clock input.
7	DVSS	P	Ground for digital circuits.
8	VR_DIG	P	1.8V digital supply voltage generated by internal LDO.
9	DVDD	P	3.3V power supply for I/O and HP.
10	AVSS	P	Ground for analog circuits.
11	AVCC	P	26.4V power supply for analog circuits.
12	GVDD	P	Internal power supply generated by LDO.
13	VR_ANA	P	Analog reference voltage.
14	BSTPR	P	Bootstrap supply for VOUTPR.
15	VOUTPR	AO	Positive output of RCH.
16	PVDDR	P	26.4V power supply for RCH.
17	VOUTNR	AO	Negative output of RCH.
18	BSTNR	P	Bootstrap supply of VOUTNR.
19	BSTNL	P	Bootstrap supply of VOUTNL.
20	VOUTNL	AO	Negative output of LCH.
21	PVDDL	P	26.4V power supply for LCH.
22	VOUTPL	AO	Positive output of LCH.
23	BSTTL	P	Bootstrap supply for VOUTPL.
24	PWDNN	DI	Power down pin, low active.
25	FAULTB	DO	Fault indicator (low active).
26	A_SEL	DI	Slave address selection
27	SDA	DIO	I2C data input/output.
28	SCL	DI	I2C clock input.

(Depends on application)

(Depends on application) 
5 0x05 1 0x02 Amp turn on Amp turn on

DRC Timing Equation 
DRC Description Equation 
AA/AE/AD Timing, which is 3.23 format 
Equation : AA = (1-e-1/(ta*fs)) x 223 
ta = AA/AD/AE timing,  
fs = sampling rate 
Ex : ta = 0.1ms, fs = 48K  
    AA = (1-e-1/(0.0001*48000)) x 223 = 1577592 
DEC = 1577592 
HEX = 0x181278 

1-AA/1-AE/1-AD Timing 
Equation: 1-AA = (0x800000-AA timing) 
Ex : If AA = 0x000001B4 
1-AA = (0x800000 - 0x000001B4) 
HEX = 0x007FFE4C 
1-AA/1-AD, must be follow the equations AA+(1-AA) = 1, AD+(1-AD) = 1 for RMS and peak mode. 
For peak mode, 1-AE, must be defined by users and there is no limitation. 
For RMS mode, 1-AE, must be calculated and follow the equation AE + (1-AE) = 1.

DRC Description Equation 
DRC_T : Threshold 
T is the threshold of the DRC 
Equation: T = (Threshold-24)/6.0206 (dB) 
Ex : T = 4.5dB,  
(4.5-24)/6.0206 = 4.733747 
T_Dec = 4.733747*2^23= 39709551 
T_Hex = DEC2HEX (39709551) = 0xFDA21490 

DRC_K : Compress ratio 
K is the compression ratio of the DRC 
Equation : K = (1/Ratio-1) + 8 
EX : Ratio = 8 
 (1/8-1) + 8 = 7.125 
 K_Dec = 7.125*2^23 = 59768832 
 K_Hex = DEC2HEX (59768832) = 0x3900000 

DRC_O : Make up gain 
O is the offset of the DRC 
Equation : O = 10(Offset-24)/20 
EX : Offset = 0dB  
 10^(0-24/20) = 0.063095 
 O_Dec = 0.063095*2^23 = 529285 
 O_Hex = DEC2HEX (529285) = 0x0081385

Bypass DRC 
Block Diagram & Description 
Separate each channel of the DRC, If MB_BYPASS = 1, the output signals will be mix of HB and LB

MBDRC first order setting 
Block Diagram & Description

Address BITS Name Description 
0xC1 
7 SKIP_BQ1_L_MBAND 
(register 0x78)  
0 : Coefficients applied to 2 identical BQ stages  
1 : Coefficients applied to 1 stage only, 1 is skipped 
... 

Address BITS Name Description 
0xC2 
4 SKIP_DRC_L_HPF 
L_HPF for MB and HB DRC 
0 : Normal Mode 
1 : SKIP 
...

DRC4 is final stage of DRC. It can be configure as the final DRC to limit the output power. 
Block Diagram & Description 

Address BITS Name Description 
0x0A 7:0 DRC4_DELAY[7:0] 
DRC4_DELAY  
The delay make the audio signal output delay  
Delay = (DRC4_DELAY) * 1 / sample rate  
This maximum value is 0x8F, if the setting is larger 
than 0x8F , it will limit at 0x8F

Address BITS Name Description 
0x70 
7 DRC4_PEAK 1 : Peak mode 0 : RMS mode 
6 DRC3_PEAK 1 : Peak mode 0 : RMS mode 
5 DRC2_PEAK 1 : Peak mode 0 : RMS mode 
4 DRC1_PEAK 1 : Peak mode 0 : RMS mode

The gain stage after mixer output

PRE_SCALE, u[31:26],
pre[25:0], 9.17 format
Bit 25 is sign bit

Range : 24dB (0X200000) to Mute (0x00000000)
Ex : 24dB, Hex = 0x200000
Dec = 2097152
Gain = 20Log (2097152 / 131072) = 24dB

Compensate Filter 
Compensation filter is purpose to compensate internal gain from DAC, this filter can also compensate the frequency response affected by LC filter, recommended setting will based on different application circuit to fit the curve.

Compensate Description Equation 
Compensate 
y[n] = B3*x[n-6]+B2*x[n-5]+B1*x[n-4]+B0*x[n-3]+B1*x[n-2]+B2*x[n-1]+B3*x[n] 

 B0, B1, B2, B3 : Compensate coefficient 
 N : Input signal when applied

Volume Ramp 
000 : 1 step in every sample 
001 : mute  40dB, every sample with 1 step. 40dB  24dB, 2 sample with 1 step. 
010 : mute  40dB, 2 sample with 1 step. 40dB  24dB, 4 sample with 1 step. 
Others : mute  40dB, 4 sample with 1 step. 40dB  24dB, 8 sample with 1 step.

Hard Clip Function
To clip the signal with different threshold, operate in time domain.

DC Protection Function
It is to use to protect the loudspeaker, when there are some DC exists at the output. The method is to detect DC at final stage (PWM), calculate the difference of the PWM and a sinc filter to decide the DC level. The IC will shut down when detect the DC.

PBTL Function 
It can be configure by the hardware, also need to change the software setting 
The Input signal, can be configured by the input mixer, from register 0x53 to configure the input signal. 

Mono PBTL Application Circuit 
[Circuit diagram]

Mono Configuration 
To use the mono configuration, It can be configured by register setting. 

[Register settings]

Mono Configuration Example 
Use Left Channel 
Set the Bit[7], Bit[5], Bit[3], Bit[1] to Zero, others keep 1 

[Circuit diagram]

Mono Configuration Example 
Use Right Channel 
Set the Bit[6], Bit[4], Bit[2], Bit[0] to Zero, others keep 1 

Reference Clock Selection 
Due to the coefficient of PLL can be automated selected, so the RT9114B can choose the MCLK/SCLK as the reference clock from register setting.

Protection Behavior 
If the protection behavior happened, the IC will automated detect, there are some behavior as below list. 

Protection Auto recovery Shutdown Amp Fault pin pull low 
DC Protection No Yes Yes 
MCLK EEOR Depends on 0xD1 bit[6] Yes Yes, depends on 0xD0 bit[6] 
SCLK ERROR Depends on 0xD1 bit[5] Yes Yes, depends on 0xD0 bit[5] 
LRCK ERROR Depends on 0xD1 bit[4] Yes Yes, depends on 0xD0 bit[4] 
OC ERROR Depends on 0xD1 bit[3] Yes Yes, Depends on 0xD0 bit[3] 
OV ERROR Depends on 0xD1 bit[2] Yes Yes, depends on 0xD0 bit[2] 
OT ERROR Depends on 0xD1 bit[1] Yes Yes, depends on 0xD0 bit[1] 
UV ERROR Depends on 0xD1 bit[0] Yes Yes, depends on 0xD0 bit[0]

Fault Behavior Type Select 
If the protection behavior happened, the IC will automate detect, there are some error type can be configured  as below list. 

Address BITS Name Description 
0xD1 
6 MCLK_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery  
1 : Latch 
5 SCLK_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery  
1 : Latch 
4 LRCK_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery  
1 : Latch 
3 OC_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery(Don't set to 0, it will cause IC damage when OC fault happen) 
1 : Latch 
2 OV_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery  
1 : Latch 
1 OT_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery  
1 : Latch 
0 UV_ERROR_FAULT_TYPE 
Fault behavior type select.  
0 : Auto recovery  
1 : Latch

The junction temperature should never exceed the 
absolute maximum junction temperature TJ(MAX), listed 
under Absolute Maximum Ratings, to avoid permanent 
damage to the device. The maximum allowable power 
dissipation depends on the thermal resistance of the IC 
package, the PCB layout, the rate of surrounding airflow, 
and the difference between the junction and ambient 
temperatures. The maximum power dissipation can be 
calculated using the following formula : 
PD(MAX) = (TJ(MAX) - TA) / JA 
where TJ(MAX) is the maximum junction temperature, TA 
is the ambient temperature, and JA is the junction-to-
ambient thermal resistance.

Place the decoupling capacitors as close as possible to the DVDD and DVSS Pin, AVCC and AVSS Pin for achieving good audio quality, The trace width of DVDD is 6 mil at least and The trace width of AVCC is 30 mil at least. 

The traces of VOUTPL VOUTNL VOUTPR and VOUTNR should be kept equal width and length respectively, and Bootstrap supply to Lx capacitance required close to the IC. 

If possible, coplanar ground fill on both sides for differential pair of speaker out shielding

Product Summary.content: The RT9114B is a high efficiency, I2S-input, stereo channel audio power amplifier delivering 2x20W into 8Ω BTL speaker loads. It can deliver over 90% power efficiency and eliminate the need for heat-sink.

The built-in anti-pop functions can reduce the speaker's pop noise under all kind of scenarios. Built-in protection circuits can provide over-temperature, over-current, over-voltage, and under-voltage protections and report error status.

The RT9114B is an I2S device receiving all clocks from external sources. It can support both master and slave mode with wide input sampling rate from 8kHz to 96kHz. A fully programmable data path routes these channels to the internal speaker drivers.
The RT9114B features three band DRC and flexible multi-band biquads for anti-clipping, power limiting, and speaker equalization.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Functional Pin Description: This chunk describes the pin functions of the electronic component, including data input/output, clock inputs, power supply pins, and other control pins.

Initial Sequence and Register Settings: This chunk provides the initial sequence and register settings required for configuring the component, including software reset, volume control, gain settings, and amplifier turn-on.

Typical Operating Characteristics: This chunk covers various typical operating characteristics of the component, such as current consumption vs. power supply voltage, efficiency vs. output power, output power vs. supply voltage, noise performance, output level vs. frequency, and THD+N vs. output power.
DRC (Dynamic Range Control) Timing and Equations: This chunk explains the DRC timing equations, including attack/release timing, threshold, compression ratio, and makeup gain calculations.

Input/Output Mixer, Compensate Filter, Volume Ramp, and Protection Functions: This chunk describes the input/output mixer gain settings, compensate filter for frequency response adjustment, volume ramping behavior, hard clipping function, DC protection, PBTL (Parallel Bridge-Tied Load) configuration, mono configuration, and various protection behaviors (DC, clock errors, overcurrent, overvoltage, overtemperature, undervoltage) with fault handling and masking options.

Application Circuits.content: Bypass DRC Block Diagram & Description: Separate each channel of the DRC, If MB_BYPASS = 1, the output signals will be a mix of HB and LB. Output Mixer Block Diagram & Description: The output mixer combines the signals from different channels with configurable mixing ratios specified in registers 0x51 and 0x52.

Pre-scale Block Diagram & Description: The pre-scale is a gain stage after the mixer output. It is configured via register 0x57 with a 9.17 format value ranging from 24dB (0x200000) to mute (0x00000000). Post-scale Block Diagram & Description: The post-scale is a gain stage after the pre-scale output. It is configured via register 0x56 with a 3.23 format value ranging from 12dB (0x01ffffff) to mute (0x00000000).

PBTL Function: It can be configured by hardware and requires changing software settings. The input signal can be configured by the input mixer, from register 0x53. Mono PBTL Application Circuit: Circuit diagrams are provided for mono configuration examples using the left or right channel.

Reference Clock Selection: The RT9114B can choose the MCLK/SCLK as the reference clock from register settings due to the coefficient of PLL being automatically selected. Decoupling capacitors should be placed close to the DVDD, DVSS, AVCC, and AVSS pins for good audio quality. Trace width and length requirements are specified for power and output traces.

Layout Considerations: The traces of VOUTPL, VOUTNL, VOUTPR, and VOUTNR should have equal width and length. Bootstrap supply to Lx capacitance is required close to the IC. Coplanar ground fill on both sides is recommended for differential speaker output shielding.

Reliability and Environmental Conditions.content: Typical Operating Characteristics: Current Consumption vs. Power Supply Voltage, Efficiency vs. Output power, Current Consumption vs. Output Power, Output Power vs. PVDD, FFT of Output Noise, Output Level vs. Frequency, THD + N vs. Output Power. These characteristics provide insights into the performance and efficiency of the electronic component under various operating conditions.

Protection Behavior: The component has various protection mechanisms such as DC Protection, Clock Error Protection (MCLK, SCLK, LRCK), Overcurrent (OC) Protection, Overvoltage (OV) Protection, Overtemperature (OT) Protection, and Undervoltage (UV) Protection. These protections can be configured for auto-recovery or latch behavior, and can trigger an amp fault signal.

Fault Behavior Type Select: The component allows configuring the fault behavior type for various error conditions such as MCLK, SCLK, LRCK, OC, OV, OT, and UV errors. The behavior can be set to auto-recovery or latch mode, providing flexibility in handling different types of faults.

Thermal Considerations: The junction temperature of the component should never exceed the absolute maximum junction temperature (TJ(MAX)) to avoid permanent damage. The maximum allowable power dissipation depends on the thermal resistance of the package, PCB layout, airflow, and the difference between junction and ambient temperatures. A formula is provided to calculate the maximum power dissipation based on these factors.

Packaging Information.content: Marking Information: 0E= : Product Code, YMDNN : Date Code. This chunk provides details on how the product is marked, including the product code and date code markings.

Packaging Information: Details about package types, ordering information, marking details, and shipment specifications. This chunk covers various aspects related to the packaging of the electronic component.

Ordering and Shipment Information: Specifications and guidelines for ordering the product and shipping/delivery details. This chunk focuses on the process of acquiring and receiving the electronic component.
Package Types and Marking: Description of different package types available for the component, along with marking details and identification codes printed on the packages.
